citations.narrative:
The licensee does not have complete records identifying the sources of animal acquisition and specific animal
descriptions for disposition. The records list two adults being on loan or borrowed but does not includes dates of when
they were acquired, the complete name and address from who they were on loan from, and when they left the property.
Adults who were not born on the property only have listed the name of the seller, but does not include the sellers address
nor the date they were acquired from.
For disposition the licensee did not have 7006 forms for the adult dogs. Licensee was able to provide a document
indicating a recent sale of at least 4 adult dogs. This document only listed the animals name and buyers name and
address but failed to include the animal's id, age or date of birth, breed, sex, and animal description. Failure to include all
the required acquisition and disposition information makes it difficult to properly track the movement and care of animals
covered by the Animal Welfare Act.
Each dealer shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the information concerning
each dog purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control,
or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer. Each dealer and exhibitor shall use
Record of Acquisition and Dogs and Cats on Hand (APHIS Form 7005) and Record of Disposition of Dogs and Cats
(APHIS Form 7006) to make, keep, and maintain the information required by paragraph (a)(1) of this section.
Correct by 10/24/25.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(a) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors 
The licensee does not have complete records identifying the sources of animal acquisition and specific animal 
descriptions for disposition. The records list two adults being on loan or borrowed but does not includes dates of when 
they were acquired, the complete name and address from who they were on loan from, and when they left the property. 
Adults who were not born on the property only have listed the name of the seller, but does not include the sellers address 
nor the date they were acquired from.  
 
For disposition the licensee did not have 7006 forms for the adult dogs. Licensee was able to provide a document 
indicating a recent sale of at least 4 adult dogs. This document only listed the animals name and buyers name and 
address but failed to include the animal's id, age or date of birth, breed, sex, and animal description. Failure to include all 
the required acquisition and disposition information makes it difficult to properly track the movement and care of animals 
covered by the Animal Welfare Act.  
 
Each dealer shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the information concerning 
each dog purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, 
or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer. Each dealer and exhibitor shall use 
Record of Acquisition and Dogs and Cats on Hand (APHIS Form 7005) and Record of Disposition of Dogs and Cats 
(APHIS Form 7006) to make, keep, and maintain the information required by paragraph (a)(1) of this section. 
 
Correct by 10/24/25. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
